titles.title: A resolution urging the European Union to add Hezbollah to the European Union's wide-ranging list of terrorist organizations.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.
Senate Committee on Foreign Relations discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and an amended preamble by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary: 4/29/2005--Passed Senate without amendment. Urges the European Union (EU) to classify Hezbollah as a terrorist organization for purposes of prohibiting EU funding to it, and recognizing it as a threat to international security. Condemns Hezbollah's continuous terrorist attacks, and its support of Palestinian terrorist organizations on the EU terrorist list, such as the Al Aqsa Martyrs Brigade, Hamas, the Palestinian Islamic Jihad, and the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine. Calls on Hezbollah to disarm and disband its militias in Lebanon, as called for in United Nations Security Council resolution 1559.
